instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not Getting <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here that initially was not powering on. Turned out to be bad <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> MOSFETS. Had to replace both and the board turned on but no video. Get chime sound but no display, neither internal nor external. After inspection I found some bad resistors around <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> area. Replaced <RESISTOR>R9300</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9301</RESISTOR>, also <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> just in case. Same result. Start measuring signals and found that <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> gets power but gets no EN signal on pin 38. Now I'm stuck and don't know exactly what to do. Suspecting bad <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> since it's the chip that generates that signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not Getting <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"bad <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> MOSFETS"
Which ones?

Check GPU power up sequence, at page 68.

threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75614, member: 682"]
"bad <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> MOSFETS"
Which ones?

Check GPU power up sequence, at page 68.
[/QUOTE]
I had to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> specifically. I'm checking GPU sequence right now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not Getting <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I don't have the first step that is <SIGNAL>EG_RAIL1_EN</SIGNAL>, hence no <SIGNAL>GPU_3</SIGNAL>.3V described in page 68
